Phobia checked his scanners, he saw an arc in the temporal field as 
the mountain was reduced to rubble."It's begun" he said under his 
would be breath (If they accually breathed) as a temporal wave hit 
his ship. hundreds of lifeforms were just destroyed. Billions will 
never exist. He knew something had to be done. Who knew the 
repercussions of what would have happened if the Autobots and 
Decepticons had crashed on a barren lifeless planet.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Roaklin <roaklin@y...> wrote:
> 
> 
>   "This ship is a warship Megatron," Panzertron said
> calmly," My crew and I are here to accomplish a
> mission. As to the beast wars we shall see how long
> the Militrons will participate in that. If we stay we
> shall see just who we side with."
> 
>   Panzertron checked his ship's chrono, it wouldnt be
> long before the Alliance leader showed up, in fact he
> should be with in visual range of the Iron Fist if his
> calculations where correct.
> 
>   " Main battery crews to thier stations," Panzertron
> said," Set course two-seven-one, increase speed to
> maximium."
> 
>   "Gun crews to thier stations, speed 33 knots," one
> of the drones replied.
> 
>    "I'm going to demonstarte the main battery for
> you," Panzertron said. A small island came into view.
> It wasn't very big, oval shaped and low to the water
> except for a moutian on one end. It was very far away.
> 
>   " Bring us about, fifteen degress, prepare to fire
> starboard broadside," Panzertron ordered.
> 
>    Perfectly the ship's bow swung one way and the main
> battery turrets swung the other, all eight of the
> plasma rifles aiming toward the island.
> 
>   "Select mountain as target," Panzertron said," You
> may fire when ready."
> 
>    A short time later the eight plasma rifles
> thundered sending shearing red beams of energy
> slamming into the mountain. The mountain exploded into
> smoke, dust and debris and no longer exisisted.
> 
>  "They do more damage to ship's hulls then soild
> rock," Panzertron said," And can hit from quite away
> aways. The only problem is they take a few seconds to
> build up thier charge again after each discharge."
>
